definition: jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mound/hillock/grave/classifier for fields
surname Qiu
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
old term for northern peoples/silent
raccoon dog (Nyctereutes procyonoides)/raccoon of North China, Korea and Japan (Japanese: tanuki)/also pr. [hao2]

sentences.english: The federal stimulus package falls into the same category.
sentences.chinese: 聯邦政府的經濟刺激方案與上述政策淪爲了一丘之貉。

sentences.english: A boaster and a liar are all one .
sentences.chinese: 愛吹牛的人和騙子都是一丘之貉。

sentences.english: Prejudice and contempt, cloaked in the pretense of religious or political conviction are no. different.
sentences.chinese: 帶着宗教或政治面具的偏見和輕蔑也都是一丘之貉。

sentences.english: I am not surprised those two is such friends; they is birds of a feather.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個人交情這麼好我不驚訝，他們是一丘之貉嘛。

sentences.english: He has conspired against me like the rest, and they are but birds of a feather.
sentences.chinese: 他和其餘的人一樣陰謀同我作對，他們是一丘之貉。

sentences.english: Nakajima said. "All imperialist powers were part of the same gang to him."
sentences.chinese: 在他看來，所有帝國主義強權都是一丘之貉。

sentences.english: They are birds of a feather.

definition: villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to act in collusion (idiom)
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
to work against the interests of sb one derives support from/to double-cross one's employer/to bite the hand that feeds you
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
hunting dog/hound/(fig.) running dog/lackey
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
lit. heart of wolf and lungs of dog (idiom)/cruel and unscrupulous
scum of a community/degenerate
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
